attributes.action: Increase defence spending to at least 3.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: The number of combat ships in service is woefully low. This isn't acceptable for an island nation. We should have a steady return to 1985 levels , otherwise risk getting caught short , like nearly happened with the Falklands conflict.

attributes.action: Allow "hoverboards" to be used on pavements
attributes.background: Currently hoverboards are not allowed on the public pavements. Many countries such as the USA and other EU countries are allowing it and they are after all a useful mode of transport. Unfortunately an out of date highways act says that we can't and it's high tide this is changed.

attributes.action: Placejob seekers on work programs within 6weeks of oringially signing on
attributes.background: To change the official help and courses job seekers receive down to 6 weeks of being unemployed rather than 6 months - the government needs to recognise that just because that a person has only just signed on, they may have been out of work a lot longer.

attributes.action: Introducing a theory test with Motorcycle Compulsory basic training
attributes.background: Motorcycles are an increasing form of transport, from delivery, commuting to pleasure. New motorcycle riders with no experience can legally ride without adequate training. Learner Motorcycle riders do not need to pass a theory test, producing inconsiderate, dangerous riders with poor road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
Current legislation states that a rider, whether young, old and of all level of experiences can learn to ride a motorcycle on the roads by simply completing a Compulsory basic training course. 
This consists of a manoeuvring and bike control session, then a road competence ride which is supervised.
During the CBT an instructor will assess your knowledge of the Highway code. This is not enough, too many riders put themselves at risk by not fully understanding the rules of the road.

attributes.action: Review how families are means tested for benefits.
attributes.background:
Why is it only those who do not work or those on low income that get support from the government?

What about those hard working families with a household salary that looks great on paper, who pay thousands in taxes a year, that struggle to afford everyday living costs?
attributes.additional_details:
I personally think there needs to be a complete over-hall in how people are means tested in order to receive benefits and what financial help is made available to all families that struggle regardless of their household income.

My self and my partner on paper have a pretty good household income. Just over Â£50k a year. However, when you take away costs such as rent/mortgage, utility bills, childcare, travel, food, and everyday living we are left with not much to spare.

attributes.action: Give photo ID cards to Veterans
attributes.background: I  joined my regular Battalion The Royal Welch Fusiliers. During my time in The RWF I was lucky enough to visit such places as Germany, Cyprus, Central America (Belize) and of course visited Northern Ireland four times ( 1973, 1974, 1075 & 1976)

attributes.action: Ensure that Boxing Day is held specifically on 26th December. Day after Xmas day
attributes.background: If 26 Dec is on a Sun, Boxing Day in the UK is moved to 27 Dec. In the UK, Boxing Day is a bank holiday. If Boxing Day is on a Sat, the following Mon is a substitute bank holiday. On occasion when Xmas Day is on a Sat, the following Mon is Boxing Day and Tue a substitute bank holiday for Xmas.
attributes.additional_details:
The intention is to fix Boxing Day to the 26th Dec regardless of what day it falls on so that it is observed formally as a national holiday.

This would mean that if Boxing Day falls on a Saturday or a Sunday, that day is observed as Boxing Day and (Sunday) the Day of Rest is observed on the Monday instead.

This Petition is about recognising the priorities and people and how times have changed. Boxing Day would be given priority over business and Sunday day of rest.

attributes.action: Include Religious Studies as a Humanities subject in the English Baccalaureate.
attributes.background: The exclusion of RS from the EBacc is leading to a reduction in the overall understanding of religion in the UK, and suggests that RS is an unimportant subject. In a world increasingly defined by a lack of understanding of religious belief, this is a clear mistake by the Government.

attributes.action: Stop Dover Harbour Board dredging the Goodwin Sands.
attributes.background: Dover Harbour Board want to extract marine aggregate from the Goodwins. Home to 350 grey seals and the some 2,000 shipwrecks. We are already susceptible to erosion. Beach recharging works are constant. Flooding along the East Kent coast is continual problem which would be exacerbated by dredging.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a current petition to raise awareness, as detailed below.
https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/goodwin-sands-sos-stop-the-dredge
This has reached over 12,000 signatures.
Please help save the Goodwin Sands and their neighbouring environment from the destruction of dredging by signing this petition today and also by writing to the Marine Management Organisation with your concerns.
Letters can be emailed to marine.consents@marinemanagement.org.uk quoting the reference 
MLA/2016/00227.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from automatically opting us in to third party marketing.
attributes.background: When calling various service providers such as car insurance companies, housing insurance, mobile phone companies there is often a prerecorded massage at the start of the call stating that they will pass on your details to third party companies for marketing purposes, you need to ask to be opted out
attributes.additional_details:
Having spent 20 minutes online trying to get car insurance quotes and speaking to 1 company who had a similar pre recorded message that was unable to provide the required service I have been plagued by sales calls trying to sell me similar and unrelated products due to being automatically opted in.

This practice is wrong and parasitic, if companies want to sell or benefit from marketing your details they should be the ones asking, the burden to opt out should not be placed on the consumer.

attributes.action: Toughen Rules on online gambling & self exclusion in the UK
attributes.background: After going through a massive gambling problem myself I believe the UK is still failing to protect problem gamblers. I believe if you are self excluded from one company this should exclude you from all companies as there's way too many and you can just open another account.
attributes.additional_details: Also many companies although not all do not make it easy for you to be able to check if a particular site is owned by one you are already excluded from. and more than often if this happens the company is just taking your money and hiding behind daft T&CS. and not really helping the problem gambler. Also make it standard practice to have self exclusion buttons on uk gaming sites again to protect the player and so they can be instantly excluded.

attributes.action: Equality and fairness : Child Benefit system
attributes.background: Separated parents (with parental responsibility) that have shared custody of their children should be allowed to have an equal share in the benefits received for the children; the current system only allows one person to claim for child benefit.

attributes.action: Restrict all heavy lorries with speed limiters to one lane on motorways.
attributes.background: As heavy vehicles are fitted with speed limiters, overtaking can take several miles and cause congestion and tailback to vehicles without speed restrictors.
attributes.additional_details: The effect is to cause congestion and tailbacks to other motorway users.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for new Vehicles to have automatic emergency braking
attributes.background: To help prevent accidents and deaths on the road by making it a legal requirement for new cars, vans and trucks to have automatic emergency braking systems

attributes.action: Increase the Teacher Training Bursuries for Core subjects and Primary Education.
attributes.background: The teacher training bursury for Biology has been slashed by Â£5000 since last year and is unacceptable. Biology is a core subject and should be treated with the same respect as Chemistry and Physics. To take away from the bursury will only push teachers to leave and teach abroad.
attributes.additional_details: The teacher training bursury is given to students hoping to become either primary or secondary school teachers, it is used to help pay their course fees of Â£9000 and their living expenses for the year as they do not recieve pay even though they will be working full time. Subjects that require specialism recieve a larger bursury. Biology is not an easy subject and is a core subject throughout young people's time In education and should be given the same bursury as chemistry and physics.

attributes.action: Make the mechanics behind weight gain and loss compulsory for secondary schools
attributes.background: 64% of the UK population is overweight/obese. Many simply donât understand why they are obese, and thus do not have the first idea of how to combat it. Basic information such as calculating Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE) should be taught in secondary schools.
attributes.additional_details:
The average British personâs total daily energy expenditure is 2000 calories. Eating just 100 calories over this per day will lead to an average weight gain of nearly 10.5 pounds (4.7kg) a year. 100 calories is one large apple, half a plain bagel, or a packet of crisps.

Being overweight or obese is connected to many health problems, such as high blood pressure, diabetes, sleep apnoea and some cancers, as well as significantly reducing life expectancy and quality of life.

attributes.action: Compensate overseas pensioners re post Brexit drop in the Pound.
attributes.background: We, pensioners aged 72 & 79 (ex RAF- now 70% disabled)  left Britain in 1991 to go and live in France. After 19 years we joined our daughter in Germany. We know about fluctations of the Pound, but enough is enough. Since the referendum we have lost around 100 E every 4 weeks and it's getting worse!
attributes.additional_details:
My husband receives a Basic Pension (85%) and attendance allowance payments 4(weekly) , I receive the married woman's part of his pension.
The first payments after  the referendum were minus 92 Euros and with each subsequent payment the minus has increased. It's shocking. I can supply details if required.

attributes.action: It should be law that the Governor of the Bank of England is a UK Citizen
attributes.background: The UK leads the world in its financial expertise, and there are UK citizens experienced in this field that could do the job, but the position is currently held by a non UK national.

attributes.action: Have an annual referendum on the most signed petition to make it legally binding
attributes.background: In late 2006 the government set up the e-petitions website as a way for people to engage with politics. Millions of people have signed petitions, but we still don't feel like these petitions are given any real attention or importance. Petitions having the chance to become laws would change this.
attributes.additional_details:
The e-petitions website was created in November 2006 and the created petitions cover everything from tax to immigration, moral and ethical concerns, education, science and the very direction of the country. 

In 2015, the BBC reported "an unnamed government minister branded the site an own-goal thought up by a "prat"". 
People still don't feel the issues they are passionate about are taken seriously. We create and sign petitions because we want to see change, we want our voices to be heard.

attributes.action: Smoking Should be Banned on Outside Station Platforms (Especially Merseyrail)
attributes.background:
"Smoking is permitted on our surface stations" - Merseyrail.org

Merseyrail allow smoking on their surface (i.e. outside) platforms. This is a disgrace! Platforms can become very congested with people and thus causing others to inhale second-hand smoke, including children and pregnant women.
attributes.additional_details:
One might argue that smoking is okay as it is still considered outside. However on the street people have the option to cross the road or move away whereas, at a station platform passengers do not have this option and instead must inhale second-hand smoke. 

London Overground stations prohibited smoking on surface platforms. Merseyrail is clearly behind modern times. If London has adopted this policy then why hasn't Merseyrail?

It is of this author's opinion that the Health Act 2006 should be amended so that smoking should be banned on any train platforms in England.

attributes.action: Make the supplier of broadband supply the speed you should get and pay for
attributes.background: I should get 200 meg but only get 57 meg like most people on the supplier forum

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to set up sports teams for both genders.
attributes.background:
"Rugby is for boys," "Netball is for girls." 
Gender inequality in sport exists in schools, clubs and at the elite level.
All pupils should be encouraged to take part in any sport.  How hard is it to set up a rugby team for boys and a rugby team for girls? 
You can make a change!

attributes.action: Ban Votes for anyone over the age of 70
attributes.background: In the referendum most young people- 17 or below did not have the chance to decide their future, where old pensioners were allowed to vote and decide our future for us! We want more control for young people!
attributes.additional_details: Such as in the referendum, despite a petetion and growing debate for votes for 16 year olds, the number of old people is on the increase, due to the baby boomers getting older! Therefore to restrict the age this way it would help keep down the number of old people voting and put more decision in the younger generations.

attributes.action: Increase Government powers over interest rates to protect savers.
attributes.background: Since 2008 the Bank of England has relentlessly cut interest rates causing savers to lose a considerable amount of income and this has now reached an unacceptable level.  At the moment, the Government has limited power over interest rates.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls for greater Government powers of the Bank of England's interest rates, so that savers can be protected.

attributes.action: Request aid from United Nations World Food Programme in reducing malnutrition
attributes.background: Documented cases of child malnutrition are increasing in deprived areas in the UK. Local authorities do not have the resources to cope, and central government funding strategies are exacerbating the situation. Outside help appears to be the only available option.

attributes.action: Drones need unique reg number created by manufacturer which is assigned to buyer
attributes.background:
Problem is there is currently no way of matching a Drone with an owner.

Worse case was a Drone which collided with a British Airway flight over Heathrow. Story covered on 18th April, 2016 - Daily Telegraph
attributes.additional_details:
Daily Telegraph

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2016/04/18/drone-laws-in-the-uk--what-are-the-rules/

BBC

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-35442130

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find Â£8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over Â£10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Fine cyclists who block roads when a dedicated cycle path is right next to them.
attributes.background:
Living in a city and being a motorist, I'm sick to death of cyclists holding up busy main roads by cycling on the road itself when dedicated cycle paths have often been built specifically for them at tax payer's expense.

It's time cyclists learned to respect the rules of the road as drivers must.

attributes.action: Make the glamorous promotion and unavoidable shop displays of alcohol illegal.
attributes.background: Alcohol is promoted on tv in every ad break, its at the entrance of every supermarket and at the end of every aisle! In the summer the ads and supermarkets tell you its not summer without a beer, you can't enjoy a bbq or dinner party without wine, that wine makes you better company around friends!!
attributes.additional_details: Im not saying ban it! But lets stick it in a separate section in the supermarket that is out of sight and not the first thing you see as you walk in!! Don't glamourise it in front of our kids but don't make it a forbidden fruit either!! Keep it out of the local all night stores and remove the ads that glamourise it from our tv, magazines and billboards! Lets have some balance, some honesty, some education please!! We all know where the alcohol is and if we want it, we know where we can buy it!!

attributes.action: An election be held on the 4th Thursday after the death or resignation of an MP.
attributes.background: All too often a by election is delayed by the incumbent party to further their own aims.  The Constituents deserve to be represented and no delay should be permitted.

attributes.action: Enable police to automatically seize bicycle when caught red light jumping.
attributes.background: Everyday, thousands of cyclist ignore red traffic lights. Little is done other than to provide small fine or "slap on the wrist", this clearly is not an effective deterrent. Allowing the police to automatic seize an offenders bicycle might make people thick twice.

attributes.action: Change the Examination System for Mathematics in the UK
attributes.background: My daughter had five attempts at passing her GCSE Mathematics and I see from TV reports that many children are struggling to pass leaving us with a generation of children who may never pass due to the rigours of the examination containing techniques that none of us ever use again.
attributes.additional_details: Why don't we have one exam containing addition, multiplication, subtraction and division for the less able students allowing them to at least leave school with a qualification and a more in depth exam for those wishing to study mathematics or wish careers where complicated maths is needed. Even my sons maths tutor could not finish the higher GCSE exam and he has a degree in maths. Why doesn't the government take notice of what is happening -  The Exam system is broken.

attributes.action: Cut overseas aid from over Â£12bn a year to Â£1bn a year
attributes.background: Nhs,education,benefits,schools community programs are in the news every day telling us they don't have enough money .Let people give money to the charities they support and not be dictated to by the government.We have a rich history of giving to charities but it's time to put our citizens first.

attributes.action: Strengthen punishments for hate crimes against LGBT and other people.
attributes.background:
LGBT, religious minorities and other people experience hate crimes on a daily basis.
The current system is broken, crimes are not reported because the fear of the perpetrator being let off easily, this needs to change.

We call on her majesty's government to strengthen punishments for hate crime.
attributes.additional_details:
LGBT, religious minorities and other people experience hate crimes on a daily basis.
The current system is broken, crimes are not reported because the fear of the perpetrator being let off easily, this needs to change.

We call on her majesty's government to strengthen punishments for hate crime, and to put an emphasis on eradicating inequality.

Instagram & Twitter: @St__Campagin
Facebook: Stronger Together

attributes.action: Immediately remove license from ALL drivers if caught on  Phone while driving
attributes.background: Remove license with Â£200 fine for all drivers caught on phone

attributes.action: Make Care Leavers Exempt From Housing Benefit Cuts OR Provide Adequate Housing
attributes.background: Care leavers are seven times more likely to die before they hit 21!! And those who don't are highly likely to go onto offending, substance misuse, violent relationships and poor mental health etc due to the lack of support. Stop setting these young people up to fail!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.disabledgo.com/blog/2017/02/early-deaths-among-care-leavers-revealed/#.WL8HXcjfWJJ
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-33551256

http://www.barnardos.org.uk/get_involved/corporate_partnerships/barnardos-in-business/care_leavers__set_up_to_fail_.htm

attributes.action: Do a 3 month trial of letting people choose what their tax gets paid on.
attributes.background: Letting people choose what their tax gets paid on each month may help us feel more positive about the amount of tax we pay.

attributes.action: Lower insurance premiums for 17- 25 year olds.<Â£1500
attributes.background: Earning minimum wage and cannot afford such a high insurance premium on such a low wage. Something needs to be done.

attributes.action: Ban all Americans from the UK until Donald Trump's Muslim Ban is revoked.
attributes.background:
Donald Trump has imposed a disgusting ban on people from majority Muslim nations under the guise of a national security issue despite the fact that no terrorist attack on American soil has originated in those countries. 

We ask that all Americans be banned until Trump realises his error.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to implore the government to make a strong statement that Britain is against islamophobic policies and communicate this to Steve Bannon & Donald Trump in a language that they cannot ignore.

attributes.action: Make schools teach the dangers of using drugs and alcohol
attributes.background: Children become curious from a young age because not enough is being taught about this stuff in schools but like sex education they should be playing Video clips of the reality of what can happen when you take drugs and drink heavily, A once a week lesson in this could change many children's minds.

attributes.action: Start banning people with 12 or driving points as they keep getting more
attributes.background: Highway code states that anyone who gets 12 points or more MAY be banned. Why may when they have committed the crime more than once
attributes.additional_details:
New drivers in the first 2 years getting 6 points or more will lose their licence so why not driver who have more than 2 years
 I call this discrimination against new drivers and letting others get away with breaking the law

attributes.action: Align all Parliamentary Constituencies with Local Government boundaries.
attributes.background:
Benefits:

Reducing the number of MPs from the current 600 planned to approximately 400, thereby reducing cost to the taxpayer.

Creates a direct link between local and national representation.

Constituency Office funding directly related to the size of the Local Authority's Electoral Roll.
attributes.additional_details:
The current system is based on the somewhat outdated idea that each constituency contains roughly the same number of voters, supposedly creating an equality of representation.

Given that MPs only have one vote the size of their constituency is immaterial.

As we elect MPs to represent us in Parliament it is the relationship between a local MP and their constituents that is far more important than the size of the constituency.

attributes.action: 21st Century Britain Needs a Written Constitution
attributes.background: Post Brexit Multicultural UK needs a written constitution. Democracy is fragile, the citizens of the country are responsible to safe guard it. A written constitution will empower them to be the watch dogs of democracy. This will ultimately make the majority accommodate and the minority reassured.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop foreign companies taking over British successful companies
attributes.background: Over the last 30 years, many of Britainâs successful and well known companies have been taking over by foreign companies, only to be broken up or their factories moved aboard. This new law would stop this practice if it was considered not be in the national interest.

attributes.action: Our schools are struggling due to funding cuts. Redirect foreign aid to schools
attributes.background: Our schools are struggling http://m.bristolpost.co.uk/olympus-headteacher-asks-parents-for-donations-as-budget-cuts-drive-schools-to-crisis-point/story-30155492-detail/story.html We are paying vast amounts to countries such as India who state they have not requested or need. Redirect to schools
attributes.additional_details: Schools are discussing four day weeks, increased class sizes and parent contributions as they struggle to afford to educate children in state schools due to increasing pupil numbers. It is the children of the less affluent in society those who cannot afford private education who will suffer making the divide between rich and poor educated even wider. Although it is commendable to help other countries it should not be at the expense of our children's future and their education

attributes.action: Ban the delivery of charity collection bags to households in the U.K.
attributes.background: Large plastic charity bags, wrapped in plastic envelopes are delivered to thousands of households in the U.K. every week. Only a tiny percentage are filled for collection with the majority ending-up straight in the homeowners bin and off to landfill. This unnecessary use of plastic bags must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
It is believed that 500,000 plastic charity collection bags are sent to landfill every year. Each bag is delivered inside yet another plastic bag envelope meaning some one million bags are disposed of in our landfill sites around the country every year, via doorstep delivery.
Most local council recycling stations, as well as many towns and villages retain clothing bins and can be freely used to dispose of such unwanted goods easily and without the need for such large scale waste.

attributes.action: Introduce knowledge on diversity and the LGBT+ to the primary school curriculum
attributes.background: If children are introduced to diversity and the lgbt+ community from a young age this could prevent racism and homophobia. Hate is taught not inate.
attributes.additional_details: Every single person i have encountered who support discrimination were either taught to do so or were only introduced to it via insults (e.g "that's so gay") however those of us who do not, tend to have been shown that skin colour or sexual orientation does not define a person. teaching young children about these topics and people can help them understand that everyone is different and nobody should never be ashamed of who they are.

attributes.action: Charge cyclists road tax and insurance,require to have side mirrors by law
attributes.background: Cyclists causes accidents ,damages and hold us drivers up . They should pay insurance in case they damage cars or are involved in rtc.they use our roads so they should pay some  road tax! Accidents could be prevented if riders were required to use Mirrors so they don't just pull out in front of us!
attributes.additional_details: They cause traffic ques. They have hold us up and we pay to use the road ...

attributes.action: Death sentence to offenders who kill and sexually abuse children under 16
attributes.background: Pedophiles should have no chances in doing this again to children once found out should receive the death sentence for the most serious counts of sexual abuse towards children kidnapping and death to children under 16 years of age and for not so serious a life sentence imposed meaning life in jail

attributes.action: Remove or greatly increase the petition character limit, currently capped at 880
attributes.background: The current character limit in petition descriptions is too small to include a highly meaningful body of evidence, argument, and other relevant information. Governmental ability to reply to petitions is notably unencumbered. People should be able to engage in responsive dialogue with the government.
attributes.additional_details: Many members of the public are informed on an extensive variety of subjects, ranging from obscure and niche, to popular and general interest. These people are ideally suited to approach the government via petition, to better educate the public and government alike. However, current character limitations means only small fragments of their expertise can be represented. Given the government's latitude in ability to respond to these petitions, the public should be granted similar levels of freedom.
